entry.title: SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT, Fort Albany
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 5:08 p.m. EDT Wednesday 5 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday night: Snow mixed with ice pellets. Temperature rising to minus 3 by morning.
entry.summary: Cloudy. Snow beginning early this evening. Snow or ice pellets late this evening and after midnight. Risk of freezing drizzle overnight. Snow and ice pellet amount 5 to 10 cm. Wind east 40 km/h gusting to 60 becoming southwest 30 gusting to 50 before morning. Temperature rising to minus 3 by morning. Wind chill minus 18 this evening and minus 10 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Wednesday 5 April 2023

entry.title: Thursday: Flurries. Temperature falling to minus 6 in the afternoon.
entry.summary: Flurries. Risk of freezing drizzle early in the morning. Wind southwest 30 km/h gusting to 50. Temperature falling to minus 6 in the afternoon. Wind chill near minus 14. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Wednesday 5 April 2023

entry.title: Thursday night: Flurries. Low minus 15.
entry.summary: Flurries ending before morning then clearing. Wind northwest 30 km/h gusting to 50. Low minus 15. Wind chill minus 14 in the evening and minus 23 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Wednesday 5 April 2023
